channel.title: I hope the last problem i have
channel.description:
I just got a dutch compiler that can see my upd 3 from JDK !
It says: Found JDK 1.6.0_03
ye thats good and then it says:
Results: javac: File not found: *.java Usage: Javac <options> <source files> Use -help for a list of possible options
And that "-help" doesnt work at me
Plz help....

item.title: I hope the last problem i have
item.dc:creator: @pkforlol3 pkforlol3
item.description:
@pkforlol3 wrote:

My compiler runs on:

@echo on
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: I hope the last problem i have
item.dc:creator: @You_Are_Sick You Are Sick
item.description:
@You_Are_Sick wrote:

[quote=“MrPink, post:2, topic:162962”]@echo off
COLOR 08
title Server Name
echo Thank You For Using KazaHacks Compiler
echo Now all you got to do is wait 5 seconds
“D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

This is from KazaHacks source pack, the only thing you will need to change is the Server Name and the Harddrive that your Java is saved to, for example:

If you have it saved on C: then you use:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

All you change is the first part of that line to the harddrive you have installed your Java to.[/quote]

But how can i edit compiler then ?

Read full topic
item.source: I hope the last problem i have

item.title: I hope the last problem i have
item.dc:creator: @MrPink MrPink
item.description:
@MrPink wrote:

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Server Name
echo Thank You For Using KazaHacks Compiler
echo Now all you got to do is wait 5 seconds
“D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

This is from KazaHacks source pack, the only thing you will need to change is the Server Name and the Harddrive that your Java is saved to, for example:

If you have it saved on C: then you use:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

All you change is the first part of that line to the harddrive you have installed your Java to.

Read full topic
